storyInfo: Lettou bids farewell to his comrades in Londinium, he visits the old man who could never become a Vieux Vanguard, and finally goes to the Sanguinarch of Vampires. While he is unable to kill the Sanguinarch, he chooses to splatter him with his own despicable blood.

attributes.text: In my wardrobe, I have a drawer specifically for collecting medals.

The medal I received upon graduating from Cyr Military College, the fifteen-year service medal from the Defense Forces, the Londinium Freedom Medal awarded to me by City Hall four years ago, after quelling the chaos in the city.

Deeper in the drawer are the remnants of a previous order, passed down through my family. The emblem of the Vieux Vanguard, a piece of brick from Lingones, and a golden cup awarded by His Majesty Corsica I.
\nThe cup is now split into two pieces, and the etchings on top are unclear. However, I remember the layout of each pattern, and the expressions on each relief figure.
This is all that my parents, my uncles, and aunts, all that they hoped for: the glory of Gaul, a glory that cannot be denied, and would never fade.

attributes.content: ...The cup is quite weighty. You should be able to sell it for a good price. The market for Gaulish pieces has always been brisk.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Even if you just melt the thing and sell it as raw gold, it should be enough for you to easily buy an apartment in the finest part of any city.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Here is the key to my home, keep it. The things are in the wardrobe.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Pick a place and start over. Forget everything that happened this past year, call it a fleeting nightmare.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Sir, it was you who saved me when those Sarkaz were chasing me. You hid me in the Defense Forces office.
attributes.name: Former Defense Forces Soldier

attributes.content: I should be thanking you. I'm no longer a member of the Forces, or your Gaulish compatriot...
attributes.name: Former Defense Forces Soldier

attributes.content: You didn't have to—
attributes.name: Former Defense Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Take it.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: If you find anything else in the house you like, it's yours. The memories mean little to me anymore.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You'll want to hide here for a while yet, until the situation stabilizes.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: The Military Commission has disarmed the Defense Forces. As it stands now, you're no different from the Victorian civilians to the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But our comrades are still outside. Some of them are, um, unsettled. I want to save them all...
attributes.name: Former Defense Forces Soldier

attributes.content: They've all been captured.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I handed them over to the Military Commission myself.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You what...?
attributes.name: Former Defense Forces Soldier

attributes.text: The anger in his eyes deflates before it can reach a peak.
\nA coward, I evaluated him as much in the past. He may have had some courage in battle, but ultimately, he is a coward.
\nHe survives here with me in ignominy. He can't be compared to those warriors who resist the Sarkaz.
\nHe could never compare.
\nCould I?
Hah.
\nI... don't care.
\nIt's been a long time since I cared.

attributes.content: Sir, what... are you going to do next?
attributes.name: Former Defense Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: The Sanguinarch of Vampires has been waiting for me for some time.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Stay here. Wait until it's all done before you go.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: If you want to live, you'd best pray that when you open the door, the cheering you hear is Victorians, and not the devils.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.text: \nCheering Victorians...
\nThe first thing that comes to my mind is, surprisingly, that Victoria will win.
No, it's probably just a force of habit. Naturally, I hope that Theresis will win. That's the prerequisite to him restoring Gaul.
\nAll my sacrifices, all my betrayals, all my unforgivable sins were enacted in the service of Gaul.
\nYes, of course, I serve... Gaul.
\nI hope.
Groups of people are led out by the Sarkaz forces, heading for the city walls in the distance.
\nThe Sarkaz intend to fortify Londinium, and I'm afraid the final battle lies right before us.
\nDo they plan to defend the Victorian capital? Perhaps.
Some of the men cast resentful glances at me. I know them. We once... shared a toast.
\nNo one stops me. The Sarkaz don't care where I'm going.
\nEven if you open the door for a caged fowlbeast, where can it fly?

attributes.content: René Lettou?
I didn't expect to encounter you like this.
This may be a good sign. At least you haven't been executed by the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Do you have time to chat?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Hm, I know you... You're Clovisia, the little leader of the Self-Salvation Corps, yes?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: We've cleared out all your bases, the remaining forces should have all fled Londinium. Why are you still here?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Some of the thanks go to the Defense Forces, and some go to Caster for keeping her promise.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Her Trilby Asher did indeed ensure the smooth evacuation of the Self-Salvation Corps.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: The Duke of Caster...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: ...I guessed your identity a long time ago. But now, no matter which of the dukes you're vassal or puppet of, I no longer care.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I may not know how capable you really are, but Londinium as she stands is no place for a rebellious child to be wandering around.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Go back to your hiding place. Treasure the fact that the Sarkaz have not caught you yet. I'll pretend I never saw you.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: ...Lettou.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: You've been cowering in Londinium for long enough.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: After losing contact with the Self-Salvation Corps, I quickly found new objectives to work on within Londinium.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: We... were betrayed too. And I don't even know who the traitors were.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: But I don't have time to dwell on that. The situation within the city far surpasses our understanding of a nomadic city under occupation.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: What's happening now is something you won't find in the history books.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I know that better than anyone.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But have you seen what's going on outside the city?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I've seen the Sarkaz Arts Circles, the red light in the sky, the war machines in their many forms, things unlike the military equipment of any ordinary nation.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I've seen hexcrafters floating in midair, seizing control of the sky, forcing drones and Arts alike to fail.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I used to think the descriptions of the Sarkaz military and the so-called 'Nachzehrer' were tall tales, literary embellishment for horror's sake.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I don't think that anymore.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: When death itself opens its doors, what manmade hell do we face?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: And what of the dukes?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: The ducal armies... they're resilient, grand, but...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: They stand on the horizon, out of reach.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I suppose you may be feeling guilt and melancholy, perhaps mixed with a dash of pride?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: You ponder the cruel choices you've made, but your mission is now accomplished.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I guess you proposed a deal to Theresis regarding the nomadic cities that once belonged to Gaul.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Londinium is too small, she can't contain the Sarkaz ambition. He is simply using this place to provoke the expansionist lust of Terra's other powers.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Do you honestly believe he cares at all for your Gaul?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Londinium's fall is complete, but you are no fool. You see it.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: The Military Commission of Kazdel has no intention of occupying Victoria.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Correct, I am no fool. I never once placed my hopes in Theresis keeping his word.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: And yet you still had a hand in so many tragedies.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Are you trying to create an opportunity? Like what the Sarkaz are doing for Kazdel?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Perhaps this war will exhaust the ducal militaries, making space for the ghost of Gaul to return to the land of the living.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: But the question is—
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: —Do you actually believe that, René Lettou?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: What else can I believe in?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I've admitted my weakness. Do you need me to admit my stupidity, my despair, my irrelevance?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: What do you want from me?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Cooperation.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: The Self-Salvation Corps, those resisting the Sarkaz, those struggling for survival among Victoria's nonsensical nobility, they all still have a chance.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: And that which you seek, your so-called 'Gaul', may also exist within that chance.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Gaul... oh, Gaul.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: It seems you're still willing to fight.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: For a person like you, the dusty rubble is a platform from which to grab the next ledge.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: For you, those like you, for the Military Commission...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You are strong enough to subvert a nation, to change the course of history, not to mention... manipulate the fate of one or two men like me.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Enough of the self-pity. There is still much we can do before hell descends upon us.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Whether you consider this a form of atonement or the beginning of a new struggle doesn't matter to me.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: But Lettou, I hope we can—
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Now then, oh great one, can you tell me—
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: How I might save myself?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: There it is. You haven't a clue yourself.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Let me by.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You really won't turn back?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I won't.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Then I can't say I wish you well.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Your hands are stained with the blood of so many, with the blood of my friends, and you carry on with such despicable decisions.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: René Lettou!
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: That'll do, then. Run along now, the Sarkaz are coming.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I still have... to say goodbye.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.text: Ces Lingones baignent nos yeux de larmes♪
\nLe champ de bataille est chargé d'amertume et de peine♪
\nMais ce jour viendra, c'est certain♪
\nPour juger à mort les agresseurs♪
\nPour juger à mort les agresseurs♪
A 'Vieux Vanguard' living in the city.
\nWhy is he the first thing to come to my mind in this moment?

attributes.content: ...Name! Rank! Unit!
Your baton is pressed against my waist rather harshly, sir.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Fermez-la! Report... Name, rank, and unit! Soldat!
Lingones Youth Vanguards, 2e Régiment de la Garde Sautante, Caporal Lettou!
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: My... unit?
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: Yes, your unit.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I've... never seen you... before.
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: You have, you've just forgotten, sir.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Have I...?
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: L'Empereur, Sa Majesté, he ordered me to recover here... but... I want to know... what's happening... on the front lines.
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: Le Roi-Sorcier... the wicked Witch King... did our fleet... destroy him?
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: I saw it on television... the Victorian Duke with the great... big... HUGE beard... his army!
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: Do they... wish to betray Sa Majesté... our great Emperor... they will stab him in the back... too?
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: Sir, Londinium has fallen.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: C'est bien! Good!
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: I'll be promoted... to the Vieux Vanguard! You... it's not your time yet... you still need... to prove yourself!
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.text: He's nearly ninety years old. He's been not-entirely-there for quite some time, forgetting nearly everything.
\nFor decades, his mind has remained in the golden age when the Gaulishmen joined Corsica I's march into Leithanien.
\nThe nurses always said he had only a year to live, but he's still here.
\nHe's lived to see Gaul become history.
\nHe's lived to Londinium teetering on the edge of her grave.
\nBefore I left the Defense Forces, I issued one last order, to guarantee the safety of this sanatorium.
\nThis is the only thing I did for myself in my entire long service to the Forces.

attributes.content: I brought you a Rheims Champagne, from Lingones. Your favorite. Have a seat, won't you?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: A fine drink, Caporal, mm...
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: Ces Lingones baignent nos yeux de larmes♪
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: Le champ de bataille est chargé d'amertume et de peine♪
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: ...Pour juger à mort les agresseurs...♪
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: When you sing that song, it's as if there never was any pain, as if you never aged a day.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: ...Notre drapeau sera toujours glorieux♪
attributes.name: Senile Old Man

attributes.content: I've never seen Lingones.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You told me again and again about those magnificent halls, the flourishing road networks...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: ...Do you remember Golding, the girl who visited you with me so many years ago?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: She's dead.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: She died for this cruel, unshakeable, bloodstained world.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: And I'm one of the murderers responsible for it all.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I don't know... what to feel for her.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But she's gone. She's out of my sight, and she'll certainly never see me anymore.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I... I'm frightened, sir.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: A girl called Amiya says that all I've done was done out of cowardice.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I once confessed to Golding that my only goal was to survive the ruin to come.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But I still hope...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Even if it's just a pretext, I still hope—
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: That from the ruins, a new Gaulishman will rise...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: No, that's not it.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I wish Golding could keep on teaching the children, under the sunshine, among the fragrance of the flowers.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Her persistence was truly beautiful.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But me, I'm the one who... I'm...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I've done all I can, sir. It's tiring.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Do you think we still have a future?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.text: He'd fallen asleep minutes ago.
\nRight then.
I draw my saber. A sword that once belonged to a Gaulishman.
\nI think... it might be better to let him remain in that dream before the Sarkaz force their way in.
\nAt least it'll be a splendid dream.
\nBut me... despicable man that I am, dare not reach out to pollute—
\nThe blood of the aged Youth Vanguard splatters my hands.
The Prince of Blood himself, the Sanguinarch of Vampires, looks silently at the extravagant decor of the Victorian palace.
\nThe expression on his face could be described as... serene.

attributes.content: You came, Lettou.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: Here I thought you'd find somewhere to hide.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: No, of course not.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I was always going to come find Your Highness.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You seem spirited today, I'm pleased. Ever since that old Gaulish teacher of yours died, you've been quite the buzzkill.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: I made a bet with my children, they wagered that you were about to die.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: But I believed in you, Lettou.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: Have a drink with me, to the defeat of your enemies, the death of the nation of Victoria.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: I'll begin the ritual myself, bestowing the most ancient curse, the most tragic end.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: And so I will be leaving soon. Even my own kin don't enjoy such an honor, you should be grateful.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: You know, Your Highness...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: By the time I was born, Gaul's capital had already been razed by the Duke of Wellington and his despicable accomplices.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.text: A city annihilated, as one breathes a sigh.

attributes.content: Now it seems you will do the same to Londinium.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Will you weep for her?
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: I just... didn't expect it.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Duke Wellington dismantled Lingones, pulling those mobile plates apart. Heh, so silly, so boring, the Victorians.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: Would you like to settle the blood debt with your own hands? I admire your persistence.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: I could grant you such an opportunity.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: Your Highness is most magnanimous.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.text: I bow deeply, but I feel his gaze lingering on me.

attributes.content: Ah... pathetic.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: Mean, fickle, cowardly, self-righteous.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: Begging for mercy out of fear, self-destructing out of despair.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: But I'm still very curious about you.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: In the scheme of your insignificant life, we've spent quite some time together.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: —Do you really think you can kill me, Lettou?
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: You won't.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.text: My very blood grips my heart.

attributes.content: You may think to yourself, this Sarkaz is so arrogant, so contemptuous.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: On the contrary... Lettou.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: Considering what I am about to see, I am positively filled with affection for you.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: You are a fool, yes, and despicable indeed. You should cherish your blood.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: At first, I thought they might have some more interesting uses.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: *Sigh*, such hasty farewells between us.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.text: The Gaulishman's sword... I do my best to reach it.
\nThe despicable man's sword.

attributes.content: Poor man. Keep trying, give it all you've got and you just might reach the hilt.
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: I'll... grant...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: What is it you're trying to say?
attributes.name: Sanguinarch of Vampires

attributes.content: I'm saying—
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.text: The blade cuts across my throat, cold, chilling.
\nI see my filthy blood gushing from my neck.
\nThe crimson liquid stains his clothes and splashes his face.
\nHah.

attributes.content: I'm saying... I'll... 'grant' you my blood, vile leech!
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You'll never boast about the purity of your blood ever again!
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Because the despicable René Lettou has polluted it!
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou
